title.label: THE gold standard for mobile games

content.label:
The game's amazing. The customization's great, beng able to change how your characters kit, look, callsigns, even their names. The game has a suprisingly realistic armor and penetration system, but it benefits the game that means even if you got a shield guy with the most armor, he's slow, and can still easily die from behind and the sides. 

If I had to nitpick just a tad, the prep UI is close enough to the top that if you're playing on a phone that you accidentally pull down your phone's menu, and being able to download your own mods would be nice, but the ones they offer are already great (shoutout to Red Panda). Other than those, this game is an amazing game and a gold standard as to how mobile games in general should be made.
This game is so fun and I appreciate that it is straight to the point with everything.

title.label: Doorkickers is the gold standard for CQB tactics games

content.label: The game is so realistic that I have to intentionally find situations where the immersion is broken.  And I don‚Äôt mean glitches or graphics, no I mean gameplay and mechanics.  Realistic body armor mechanics, realistic armor penetration on rifles and pistols, realistic damage model and realistic tactics.  But the best part is that this game doesn‚Äôt sacrifice anything for this level of realism, it takes a sandbox approach and lets you pause at any time to replan your approach making a highly realistic and complex game easily accessible to the casual gamer.  I can‚Äôt wait for Doorkickers 2, Killhouse Games is the fricking best.  Also Ammo Gang for life.

Best game ever

This game is a lot of fun to play. The only issue would be that it wasn‚Äôt created for mobile. So you often end up deleting planned paths or making unintentional actions in the planning stage that are frustrating due to the amount of time you have spent creating the plan. Hopefully, if they port the second game over, they take the time to correct this. Otherwise I would give this game 5 out of 5. But there wasn‚Äôt much thought spent thinking about how this game would play on an iPad or Mobile. There should be an undo button that goes back a couple of times. And you should be able to lock a fire team members path as to not accidentally modify it. Also, you cannot arrest, escort, or go up and down stairs in planning mode. So you cannot escort hostages or VIPs or plan multi-level breaches. Those are the functional gripes. As for features, I would like a status feature. As in ROE status, so you can say fire when fired upon return noticed, don‚Äôt fire, fire at will, fire if there is a clear shot and no hostages etc. It would also be cool to have a formation feature so an assault fire team member would automatically follow a shield fire team member until designated otherwise. Some of the covers don‚Äôt make sense,, for example a garbage bag gave me cover but the hood of a vehicle did not. Finally a run, jog walk function would help the planning of some attacks. All in all it‚Äôs a lot of fun if you enjoy these type of games even though there are some functional frustrations. I think I would pay 3x as much if these functional problems were fixed and these other features were added. Hopefully they spend more time on the next porting to mobile.
